alert.note: Alert for Riverside County Mountains; San Bernardino County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 08 at 3:12AM PST until November 09 at 4:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 4 PM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches above 5500 feet, 4 to 8 inches from 6500 to 7500 feet, to a few feet on the highest peaks. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph. There will also be areas of dense fog with sharply reduced visibility. * WHERE...Mountains of San Bernardino and Riverside Counties. * WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to 4 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will rise to near 8000 feet this morning, then decrease from the northwest tonight to 5500 to 6500 feet, and 4500 to 5500 feet Wednesday. For elevations below 6500 to 7000 feet, the more significant snowfall is expected for tonight into Wednesday.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Riverside County Mountains; San Bernardino County Mountains
